     5  
     6  package error116
     7  
     8  // ErrorChain implements a chain of errors.
     9  // Error chains do exist in the Go standard library but types and interfaces are not public.
    10  // error116.ErrorChain is used as an embedded type.
    11  // To instantiate, use a composite literal like ErrorChain{err}.
    12  //
    13  // error116.ErrorChainSlice returns all errors of an error chain,
    14  // or the chain can be traversed iteratively using errors.Unwrap().
    15  type ErrorChain struct {
    16  	error // the wrapped error
    17  }
    18  
    19  var _ error = &ErrorChain{}   // ErrorChain implements the error interface
    20  var _ Wrapper = &ErrorChain{} // ErrorChain implements the Wrapper interface
    21  
    22  // Unwrap is a method required to make ErrorChain an error chain
    23  // ErrorChain.Unwrap() is used by errors.Unwrap() and error116.ErrorChainSlice
    24  func (ec *ErrorChain) Unwrap() error {
    25  	if ec == nil {
    26  		return nil
    27  	}
    28  	return ec.error
    29  }
    30  

Build version go1.17.8.
